bug.short_desc: plasma 5.8.6-2 update causes black screen after login
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The following packages in the 5.8.6-2 update cause a black screen condition after login. Packages Altered: Upgraded libkworkspace5-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-lookandfeel-fedora-5.8.5-5.fc25.noarch @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.noarch @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-workspace-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-workspace-common-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-workspace-drkonqi-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-workspace-geolocation-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-workspace-geolocation-libs-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded plasma-workspace-libs-5.8.5-5.fc25.x86_64 @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.x86_64 @updates-testing Upgraded sddm-breeze-5.8.5-5.fc25.noarch @updates Upgrade 5.8.6-2.fc25.noarch @updates-testing
Backout of the above packages circumvents the issue.

2 questions:
What plasma theme are you using?
Possible to try running plasmashell by hand from this "black screen" session (via konsole or krunner)? If it crashes, we'll need a backtrace.
Re-opening upstream report of similar issue I hit while testing (but I thought I'd fixed it in plasma-workspace-5.8.6-2 packaging), https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=376847

I get the issue too :( Theme is Breeze Dark. And I cannot start anything with krunner. Had to downgrade to get a working system again.
Logs show no obvious issues, just some messages I get with 5.8.5 too:Feb 25 17:23:15 bud plasmashell[1358]: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 2 (BadValue), sequence: 22016, resource id: 113246224, major code: 141 (Unknown), minor code: 3

Rex, the issue happens with both the Fedora Breeze and regular Breeze themes. I tried using krunner, but got the same result as Christian... was able to bring up the krunner command line, but when i entered a command, nothing happened.
